<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Benefit payments (net of expected participant contributions) for other postretirement
	benefits are expected to be de minimis over the periods presented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Defined Contribution Plans
</I>
</B>
<I>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Defined contribution or profit sharing style plans are offered in Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Canada, the Czech Republic, Denmark,
	Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hong Kong, Hungary, India, Ireland, Israel, Japan, Malaysia, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Poland, Slovakia, South Africa, Sweden, Switzerland, Taiwan, Thailand, the United States and the United Kingdom. In some
	cases these plans are required by local laws or regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the United States, the Company has 401(k) plans under which the Company
	matches employee deferrals at varying percentages and specified limits of the employee&#146;s salary. In 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company expensed $39 million, $36 million and $31 million, respectively, related to matching contributions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Certain key executives of the Company participate in an unfunded defined contribution executive retirement plan, assumed in the Merger, which
	was frozen to additional accruals for future service contributions in 2012. Participants continue to receive an annual investment credit based on the average of the annual yields at the end of each month on the AA-AAA rated 10 plus&nbsp;year
	maturity component of the Merrill Lynch United&nbsp;States Corporate Bond Master Index.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Other Plans
</I>
</B>
<I>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Plans accounted for as deferred compensation contracts
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company provides certain executives with supplemental pension benefits in accordance with their individual employment arrangements. The
	above tables do not include the Company&#146;s expense or obligation associate with providing these benefits. The obligation related to these benefits was approximately $1 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, and the Company&#146;s
	expense for the year then ended was de minimis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Plans accounted for as postretirement benefits
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company provides certain executives with postretirement medical, dental and life insurance benefits. These benefits are individually
	negotiated arrangements in accordance with their individual employment arrangements. The above tables do not include the Company&#146;s expense or obligation associate with providing these benefits. The obligation related to these benefits was
	approximately $12 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, and the Company&#146;s expense for the year then ended was de minimis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Stock Incentive Plans
</I>
</B>
<I>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Stock incentive plans provide incentives to eligible employees, officers and directors in the form of non-qualified stock options, incentive
	stock options, stock appreciation rights (&#147;SARs&#148;), restricted stock awards (&#147;RSAs&#148;), restricted stock units (&#147;RSUs&#148;), performance shares, performance units, covered annual incentive awards, cash-based awards and other
	stock-based awards, in each case subject to the terms of the stock incentive plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, the Company assumed the equity incentive
	plans formerly related to IMS Health, the Quintiles IMS Holdings, Inc. 2014 Incentive and Stock Award Plan (the &#147;2014 Equity Plan&#148;) and the Quintiles IMS Holdings, Inc. 2010 Equity Plan (the &#147;2010 Equity Plan&#148;). The 2014 Equity
	Plan provides for the grant of stock options, SARs, restricted and deferred stock (including RSUs), dividend equivalents, other stock-based awards
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	131
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage132"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D321341D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	QUINTILES IMS HOLDINGS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;-&nbsp;Continued
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	and performance awards. The 2010 Equity Plan expired on April&nbsp;4, 2014 and no new awards were granted under the 2010 Equity Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As provided for in the Merger agreement, (i)&nbsp;each option to purchase IMS Health common stock outstanding immediately prior to the
	effective time of the Merger was converted into an option to acquire shares of the Company&#146;s common stock, on substantially the same terms and conditions, adjusted by the 0.384 exchange ratio; and (ii)&nbsp;each stock-settled stock appreciation
	right of IMS Health outstanding immediately prior to the effective time of the Merger was converted into a stock-settled stock appreciation right corresponding to shares of Company common stock, on substantially the same terms and conditions,
	adjusted by the 0.384 exchange ratio. The fair value of those options and stock-settled stock appreciation rights was measured using the Black-Scholes model with the following assumptions: risk-free rate (0.87% &#150; 1.49%); expected life (2.6
	years &#150; 7.6 years); dividend yield of zero; expected volatility (26% &#150; 31%). Similarly, each IMS Health stock option, performance unit (assuming 100% of performance target), restricted stock award and restricted stock unit outstanding
	immediately prior to the effective time of the Merger was converted into a similar Company award, as appropriate, on substantially the same terms and conditions, at the 0.384 exchange ratio. The fair value of these awards was allocated to purchase
	price and unearned compensation, based on the past and future service conditions. The assumed awards related to the Merger have been identified as applicable, in the tables that follow.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company recognized stock-based compensation expense of $80 million, $38 million and $30 million in 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
	Stock-based compensation expense is included in selling, general and administrative expenses on the accompanying consolidated statements of income. The associated future income tax benefit recognized was $24 million, $9 million and $8 million in
	2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, there was approximately $117 million of total unrecognized stock-based compensation expense related to outstanding non-vested stock-based compensation arrangements, which the Company
	expects to recognize over a weighted average period of 1.3 years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, there were 15.2&nbsp;million shares
	available for future grants under all of the Company&#146;s stock incentive plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company used the following assumptions when
	estimating the value of the stock-based compensation for stock options and SARs issued as follows:
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Stock Options
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The option price is determined by the Board at the date of grant and the options expire 10 years from the date of grant. The vesting schedule
	for options granted to employees is either (i)&nbsp;20%&nbsp;per year beginning on the first anniversary of the date of grant; (ii)&nbsp;25% per year beginning on the first anniversary of the date of grant; or (iii)&nbsp;33% on the third anniversary
	of the date of grant and 67% on the fourth anniversary of the date of grant. Options granted
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	132
</P>

<B>
	QUINTILES IMS HOLDINGS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>

	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;-&nbsp;Continued

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	to our non-employee directors vest either (i)&nbsp;100% on the first anniversary of the date of grant; or (ii)&nbsp;34% on the anniversary of the date of grant and 33% on the second and third
	anniversaries of the date of grant.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The weighted average fair value per share of the options granted in 2016, 2015 and 2014 was $17.91, $21.96 and
	$18.72, respectively. The total intrinsic value of options exercised was approximately $155 million, $144 million and $77 million in 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The Company received cash of approximately $101 million, $59 million and $33
	million in 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively, from options exercised.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The weighted average remaining contractual life of the options outstanding and exercisable as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2016 is 5.6 years and 4.9 years, respectively. The total aggregate intrinsic value of the exercisable stock options and the stock options expected to vest as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 was approximately $298 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Stock Appreciation Rights &#150; Stock Settled
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The exercise price of the stock-settled SARs (&#147;SSRs&#148;) is equal to the closing market price of the Company&#146;s common stock as of
	the grant date and expire on the tenth anniversary of the date of grant. The SSRs are eligible to vest in equal increments of 25% on each of the first four anniversaries of the date of grant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	133
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Prior to 2016, the Company did not have SSRs. The total intrinsic value of SSRs exercised was approximately
	$0.04 million in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The weighted average remaining contractual life of the SSRs outstanding and exercisable as of December&nbsp;31,
	2016 is 8.6 years and 7.9 years, respectively. The total aggregate intrinsic value of the exercisable SSRs and the SSRs expected to vest as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 was approximately $18 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Stock Appreciation Rights &#150; Cash Settled
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s cash settled SARs (&#147;CSRs&#148;) require the Company to settle in cash an amount equal to the difference between the
	fair value of the Company&#146;s common stock on the date of exercise and the grant price, multiplied by the number of CSRs being exercised. These awards either (i)&nbsp;vest 25%&nbsp;per year or (ii)&nbsp;vest 33% on the third anniversary of the
	date of grant and 67% on the fourth anniversary of the date of grant; or (iii)&nbsp;one-third per year beginning on the first anniversary of the date of grant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s CSR activity in 2016 is as follows (in millions, except number of CSRs and grant price):
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, the weighted average fair value per share of the CSRs granted was
	$34.25, $29.79 and $27.17, respectively. The Company paid approximately $2 million, $1 million and $0.4 million to settle exercised CSRs in 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The weighted average remaining contractual life of the CSRs outstanding and exercisable as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 is 7.2 years and 6.6
	years, respectively. The total aggregate intrinsic value of the exercisable CSRs and the CSRs expected to vest as of December&nbsp;31, 2016 was approximately $11 million.
</P>

	&nbsp;

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	QUINTILES IMS HOLDINGS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;-&nbsp;Continued
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Restricted Stock Units
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s RSUs will settle in shares of the Company&#146;s common stock within 45 days of the applicable vesting date. RSUs granted to
	employees vest either (i)&nbsp;25%&nbsp;per year beginning on the first anniversary of the date of grant; (ii)&nbsp;one-third per year beginning on the first anniversary of the grant date; or (iii) 33% on the third anniversary of the date of grant
	and 67% on the fourth anniversary of the date of grant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#146;s RSU activity in 2016 is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, there are 1.7&nbsp;million RSUs outstanding with an intrinsic value of
	approximately $131 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Performance Units
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company awarded performance units that contain both service and performance based vesting criteria. Vesting occurs if the recipient remains
	employed and depends on the degree to which the Company achieves certain cumulative adjusted diluted earnings per share goals during a three-year performance period (as defined in the award agreements). The fair value of these awards is equal to the
	closing price of the Company&#146;s common stock on the grant date. All performance units outstanding at the date of the Merger were converted into time-based RSUs at 187% of target for performance units granted in 2015 and at 100% of target for
	performance units granted in 2016. Accordingly, as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, there are no performance units outstanding.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	Company&#146;s performance units activity in 2016 is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D321341D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	QUINTILES IMS HOLDINGS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;-&nbsp;Continued
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Restricted Stock Awards
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The restricted stock awards (&#147;RSAs&#148;) issued during 2016 vest either (i)&nbsp;in equal increments of 50% on each of the second and
	fourth anniversaries of the grant date; or (ii)&nbsp;one-third per year beginning on the first anniversary of the date of grant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	Company&#146;s RSA activity in 2016 is as follows:
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2016, there are 0.4&nbsp;million RSAs outstanding with an intrinsic value of
	approximately $28 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Employee Stock Purchase Plan
</I>
</B>
<I>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company sponsors an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (&#147;ESPP&#148;) which allows eligible employees to authorize payroll deductions of up
	to 10% of their base salary to be applied toward the purchase of full shares of the Company&#146;s common stock on the last day of the offering period. Offering periods under the ESPP are six months in duration. Beginning April&nbsp;1 and
	October&nbsp;1 of each year. Participating employees purchase shares on the last day of each offering period at a discount of 15% of the closing price of the common stock on such date as reported on the NYSE. The aggregate number of shares of the
	Company&#146;s common stock that may be issued under the ESPP may not exceed 2.5&nbsp;million shares and no one employee may purchase any shares under the ESPP having a collective fair market value greater than $25,000 in any one calendar year.
	During 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company issued 0.1&nbsp;million shares, 0.1&nbsp;million shares and 0.05&nbsp;million shares, respectively, of common stock for purchases under the ESPP. Effective as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, the ESPP was
	discontinued and participant contributions under the ESPP ceased. The final purchase of shares under the ESPP occurred on December&nbsp;31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Other
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company sponsors a
	supplemental non-qualified deferred compensation plan, covering certain management employees, and maintains other statutory indemnity plans as required by local laws or regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	20. Related Party Transactions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	Company reimbursed its former Executive Chairman, who retired effective December&nbsp;31, 2015 but remains a director of the Company, for business-related travel services he provided for himself and other Company employees with the use of his own
	airplane. In 2015 and 2014, the Company expensed approximately $1 million and $2 million, respectively, for such business-related travel expenses. The Company&#146;s reimbursement obligations terminated effective December&nbsp;31, 2015 in connection
	with its former Executive Chairman&#146;s retirement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	136
</P>

<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D321341D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	QUINTILES IMS HOLDINGS, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;-&nbsp;Continued
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In January 2010, the Company entered into a collaboration agreement with a related party,
	HUYA Bioscience International, LLC (&#147;HUYA&#148;), to fund up to $2 million of its research and development activity for a specific compound. Under the agreement, the Company had the potential to receive additional consideration which
	contractually would not exceed $17 million excluding interest if certain events had occurred. In February 2015, the Company and HUYA agreed to terminate the collaboration agreement. In connection with the termination, HUYA paid the Company $5
	million to satisfy all of HUYA&#146;s various payment obligations under the collaboration agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During 2016, 2015 and 2014, the
	Company entered into a number of contracts with HUYA, primarily in Asia, in which the Company will provide up to approximately $(8 million) net cancellations, $32 million and $0.4 million, respectively, of services on a fee for services basis at
	arm&#146;s length and at market rates. In 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company provided approximately $6 million, $7 million and $2 million, respectively, of services under these agreements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has entered into other transactions with related parties including investments in and advances to unconsolidated affiliates which
	are discussed in Note 4.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	based upon where the services are performed. The Company&#146;s operations within each geographical region are further broken down to show each country which accounts for 10% or more of the totals (in millions):

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	22. Segments
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table presents the Company&#146;s operations by reportable segment. The Company is managed through three reportable segments,
	Commercial Solutions, Research&nbsp;&amp; Development Solutions and Integrated Engagement Services. Commercial Solutions provides mission critical information, technology solutions and real-world insights and services to our life science clients.
	Research&nbsp;&amp; Development Solutions, which primarily serves biopharmaceutical clients, is engaged in research and development and provides clinical research and clinical trial services. Integrated Engagement Services provides contract sales to
	both biopharmaceutical clients and the broader healthcare market.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Certain costs are not allocated to the Company&#146;s segments and are
	reported as general corporate and unallocated expenses. These costs primarily consist of stock-based compensation and expenses for corporate overhead functions such as senior leadership, finance, human resources, information technology, facilities
	and legal. The Company does not allocate depreciation and amortization, restructuring costs, merger related costs or impairment charges to its segments. Revenues and costs for reimbursed expenses are not allocated to the Company&#146;s segments.
	Asset
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	138
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The vesting of performance units is contingent upon the achievement of certain performance targets. The
	performance units are not included in diluted earnings per share until the performance targets have been met.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Stock-based awards will
	have a dilutive effect under the treasury method when the respective period&#146;s average market value of the Company&#146;s common stock exceeds the exercise proceeds.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	24. Comprehensive Income
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Below is a
	summary of the components of AOCI (in millions):
</P>

	27. Subsequent Event

	On
	February&nbsp;12, 2017, the Board increased the stock repurchase authorization under the Repurchase Program by $1.0&nbsp;billion with approximately $1.5&nbsp;billion remaining available for repurchases under the program. See Note&nbsp;14 for
	additional information regarding the Repurchase Program.

<A NAME="D321341D10K_HTM_TX321341_14">

	Financial Disclosure

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D321341D10K_HTM_TX321341_15">
</A>
	Item&nbsp;9A. Controls and Procedures
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As required by Rule 13a-15 under the Exchange Act, as amended, we carried out an evaluation of the effectiveness of the design and operation of
	our disclosure controls and procedures under the supervision and with the participation of our management, including the Chief Executive Officer (&#147;CEO&#148;) and Chief Financial Officer (&#147;CFO&#148;). There are inherent limitations to the
	effectiveness of any system of disclosure controls and procedures, including the possibility of human error and the circumvention or overriding of the controls and procedures. Accordingly, even effective disclosure controls and procedures can only
	provide reasonable assurance of achieving their control objectives. Based upon our evaluation, our CEO and CFO concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were effective to provide reasonable assurance that information required to be
	disclosed by us in the reports that we file or submit under the Exchange Act, as amended, is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the applicable rules and forms, and that it is accumulated and
	communicated to our management, including our CEO and CFO, as appropriate, to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Management&#146;s Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our management&#146;s report on internal control over financial reporting is set forth in Part II, Item&nbsp;8 of this Annual Report on
	Form&nbsp;10-K and is incorporated herein by reference.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	There were no changes in our internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 that materially
	affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>

<A NAME="eolPage152"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D321341D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	QUINTILES IMS HOLDINGS, INC. (PARENT COMPANY ONLY)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	NOTES TO CONDENSED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The condensed parent company financial statements have been prepared in accordance with Rule 12-04, Schedule I of Regulation S-X as the
	restricted net assets of Quintiles IMS Holdings, Inc.&#146;s (the &#147;Company&#148;) wholly-owned subsidiary, Quintiles IMS Incorporated exceed 25% of the consolidated net assets of the Company. The ability of Quintiles IMS Incorporated to pay
	dividends may be limited due to the restrictive covenants in the agreements governing its credit arrangements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	These condensed parent
	company financial statements include the accounts of Quintiles IMS Holdings, Inc. on a standalone basis (the &#147;Parent&#148;) and the equity method of accounting is used to reflect ownership interest in its subsidiary. Refer to the consolidated
	financial statements and notes presented elsewhere herein for additional information and disclosures with respect to these financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the Parent is part of a group that files a consolidated income tax return, in accordance with ASC 740, a portion of the consolidated
	amount of current and deferred income tax expense of the Company has been allocated to the Parent. The income tax benefit of $4 million, $1 million and $1 million in 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively, represents the income tax benefit that will be
	or were already utilized in the Company&#146;s consolidated United States federal and state income tax returns. If the Parent was not part of these consolidated income tax returns, it would not be able to recognize any income tax benefit, as it
	generates no revenue against which the losses could be used on a separate filer basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:5%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Below is a summary of the dividends paid to the

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	*
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Merger Agreement and the description thereof included herein have been included to provide investors and stockholders with information regarding the terms of the agreement. They are not intended to provide any other
	factual information about Quintiles or IMS Health or their respective subsidiaries or affiliates or stockholders. The representations, warranties and covenants contained in the Merger Agreement were made only for purposes of the Merger Agreement as
	of the specific dates therein, were solely for the benefit of the parties to the Merger Agreement, may be subject to limitations agreed upon by the contracting parties, including being qualified by confidential disclosures made for the purposes of
	allocating contractual risk among the parties to the Merger Agreement instead of establishing these matters as facts, and may be subject to standards of materiality applicable to the contracting parties that differ from those applicable to
	investors. Investors should not rely on the representations, warranties and covenants or any descriptions thereof as characterizations of the actual state of facts or condition of the parties thereto or any of their respective subsidiaries or
	affiliates. Moreover, information concerning the subject matter of representations and warranties may change after the date of the Merger Agreement, which subsequent information may or may not be fully reflected in public disclosures by Quintiles or
	IMS Health. Accordingly, investors should read the representations and warranties in the Merger Agreement not in isolation but only in conjunction with the other information about Quintiles or IMS Health and their respective subsidiaries that the
	respective companies include in reports, statements and other filings they make with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	162

</EFX_FORM>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage163"></A>
<A NAME="D321341DEX1027_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.27
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	DESCRIPTION OF
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	NON-EMPLOYEE
</FONT>
	DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2017, Quintiles IMS Holdings, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) revised its
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Employee
</FONT>
	Director Compensation Program, which is applicable to those directors who (i)&nbsp;are not employees of the Company and (ii)&nbsp;are not affiliated with the sponsor shareholders pursuant to the
	Shareholders Agreement, dated as of May&nbsp;3, 2016, among Quintiles IMS Holdings, Inc. and the shareholders identified therein (an &#147;Independent Director&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Each Independent Director will receive an annual cash retainer of $100,000 to be paid quarterly and an equity retainer with a fair value of
	$200,000, which will be granted annually. Under the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Employee
</FONT>
	Director Compensation Program, the annual equity grant will be payable in fully vested restricted stock units.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company will pay (i)&nbsp;the chair of its Audit Committee a $30,000 annual retainer, (ii)&nbsp;the chair of its Leadership Development
	and Compensation Committee a $25,000 annual retainer, and (iii)&nbsp;the chair of its Nominating and Governance Committee a $20,000 annual retainer, each to be paid quarterly. The Company will pay (a)&nbsp;the members of its Audit Committee an
	additional $10,000 annual retainer, and (b)&nbsp;the members of its Leadership Development and Compensation and Nominating and Governance Committee an additional $5,000 annual retainer, each to be paid quarterly. The Company will reimburse
	reasonable travel expenses and other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	out-of-pocket
</FONT>
</FONT>
	costs incurred in connection with attendance at board of director meetings and committee meetings by each of the
	Independent Directors.
</P>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_10>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage164"></A>
<A NAME="D321341DEX1041_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.41
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	Name of Participant:
<U>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	QUINTILES IMS HOLDINGS, INC.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	2013 STOCK INCENTIVE PLAN
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	AWARD AGREEMENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(Awarding Stock Appreciation Rights)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	THIS AWARD AGREEMENT (this &#147;Agreement&#148;) is made by and between Quintiles IMS Holdings, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the
	&#147;Company&#148;), and the Participant named above&nbsp;(the &#147;Participant&#148;) pursuant to the provisions of the Quintiles IMS Holdings, Inc. 2013 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;), which is incorporated herein by reference.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	WITNESSETH:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the
	Participant is providing, or has agreed to provide, services to the Company, or Affiliate or a Subsidiary of the Company, as an Employee, Director or Third Party Service Provider; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Company considers it desirable and in its best interests that the Participant be given a personal stake in the Company&#146;s
	growth, development and financial success through the grant of Stock Appreciation Rights (&#147;SARs&#148;) that may be exercised with respect to all or a portion of the number of whole common stock of the Company (&#147;Shares&#148;) set forth on
	Exhibit A hereto, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Award Agreement and in the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration
	of the premises and the mutual agreements set forth herein, the parties agree as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. Grant of SAR. Pursuant to the Plan, the
	Company has granted to the Participant, on the grant date listed on Exhibit A hereto (the &#147;Grant Date&#148;), SARs that may be exercised with respect to all or a portion of the number of whole Shares set forth on Exhibit A hereto, subject to
	the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement and in the Plan. For the avoidance of doubt, the total number of Shares underlying the SARs is subject to adjustment pursuant to Section&nbsp;4.4 of the Plan. The future value of such Shares is
	unknown and cannot be predicted with certainty. If such Shares do not increase in value, the SAR will have no value. For purposes of this Agreement, &#147;Employer&#148; shall mean the Affiliate or Subsidiary that employs the Participant (to the
	extent the Participant is not directly employed by the Company).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. Nature of SAR. The SARs provide to the Participant a right to
	receive, upon exercise of vested SARs in compliance with this Agreement, payment in Shares. The number of Shares that shall be delivered to the Participant upon a valid exercise of the SARs, before any reduction for withholding taxes in accordance
	with Section&nbsp;15, shall be determined by multiplying (i)&nbsp;times (ii) and dividing the resulting product by (iii), where:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	is the number of SARs being exercised;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage165"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	is the excess of (A)&nbsp;the Fair Market Value of one (1)&nbsp;Share on the date of exercise, over (B)&nbsp;the &#147;Grant Price&#148; per Share set forth on Exhibit A; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	is the Fair Market Value of one (1)&nbsp;Share on the date of exercise.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Unless otherwise
	determined by the Company, no fractional Shares will be issued in payment upon the exercise of the SARs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3. Term of SAR. Subject to
	earlier termination under Section&nbsp;5 hereof or pursuant to the Plan, the term of the SAR shall be the expiration date specified on Exhibit A hereto (the &#147;Expiration Date&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4. Use of Certain Defined Terms. Capitalized terms used in this Agreement shall have the meaning specified in the Plan, unless a different
	meaning is specified herein. In the event of a conflict between the terms and conditions of this Agreement and the Plan, the Plan shall control, except as expressly provided in Section&nbsp;4 herein. The terms set forth below shall have the
	following meanings:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	&#147;Disability&#148; shall mean: (i)&nbsp;If the Participant is a party to an employment or severance-benefit agreement that contains a definition of &#147;Disability,&#148; the definition set forth in such agreement
	shall apply with respect to the Participant under the Plan for so long as such agreement is in effect; and (ii)&nbsp;otherwise, a disability that would entitle the Participant to long-term disability benefits under the Company&#146;s long-term
	disability plan in which the Participant participates.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-acquisition
</FONT>
	service for this purpose.

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage166"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6. Vesting Schedule. Except as set forth below or in the Plan, the SARs shall become vested on
	the vesting dates set forth on Exhibit A hereto, subject to the Participant&#146;s continued Employment through the applicable vesting date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In no event will any portion of the SAR that is not vested and exercisable at the time of the termination of the Participant&#146;s service
	relationship become vested and exercisable following such termination. Further, notwithstanding any provision of the Plan or this Agreement to the contrary, in no event will any portion of the SAR that is not vested and exercisable immediately prior
	to the time of a Sale of the Company become vested and exercisable because of such event.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	7. Exercise of SAR. The Participant may
	exercise vested SARs by giving notice (in such manner as is acceptable to the Company) to the Company of his or her election to exercise such SARs. This Notice shall set forth the number of Shares with respect to which the SAR is being exercised.
	For the avoidance of doubt, the Company may in its sole discretion establish alternative means to exercise vested SARs, including electronic forms using electronic signatures and interactive voice response systems using PIN numbers, in a manner
	directed by the Company, and the SARs shall be deemed to be exercised upon fulfillment of such alternative means.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Promptly following the
	date the SARs are exercised, payment shall be made to the Participant in Shares, in accordance with Section&nbsp;2. Payment may be made by issuance of Shares in the name of the Participant and delivery of such Shares to the Participant or, in the
	discretion of the Company, by issuance and delivery of such Shares to a financial institution for the account of the Participant, or in any other commercially reasonable manner as may be determined by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8. Cash Settlement. Notwithstanding any provision in this Agreement to the contrary, the Company may, in its sole discretion, settle the
	Participant&#146;s SARs in the form of (1)&nbsp;a cash payment to the extent settlement in Shares (i)&nbsp;is prohibited under local law, or (ii)&nbsp;would require the Participant, the Company and/or the Employer to obtain the approval of any
	governmental and/or regulatory body in the Participant&#146;s country of residence (and/or country of employment, if different), or (iii)&nbsp;is administratively burdensome; or (2)&nbsp;Shares, but require the Participant to immediately exercise
	and sell such Shares (in which case, as a condition to the grant of this award, the Participant hereby expressly and explicitly authorizes the Company to issue sales instructions, on the Participant&#146;s behalf) to any brokerage firm and/or third
	party administrator engaged by the Company to hold your Shares and other amounts acquired under the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	9.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Non-Transferability
</FONT>
	of SARs. The SARs may not be transferred in any manner otherwise than by will or the laws of descent and distribution and, during the Participant&#146;s lifetime, may only be exercised by the
	Participant, and following the Participant&#146;s death, only by the Participant&#146;s legal representative or legatee, and, if the Committee permits a transfer of the SARs, by the permitted transferee. A permitted transferee will have the rights
	of the Participant with regard to any transferred SARs, subject to any limitations imposed by the Company as a condition of permitting the transfer or otherwise.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage167"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10. Restrictions on Shares. This Agreement shall be subject to all applicable laws, rules, and
	regulations, and to such approvals by any governmental agencies or stock exchange as may be required.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Participant agrees to take all steps the Committee determines are necessary to comply with all applicable provisions of
	federal, state and foreign securities law in exercising his or her rights under this Agreement. The Committee may impose such restrictions on any Shares acquired pursuant to the exercise of this SAR as it deems advisable, including, without
	limitation, minimum holding period requirements, restrictions under applicable federal securities laws, under the requirements of any stock exchange or market upon which such Shares are then listed and/or&nbsp;traded, or under any blue sky state or
	foreign securities laws as may be applicable to such Shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	11. Forfeiture; Recovery of Compensation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	Participant agree as follows:

	to the Shares issued upon such exercise (including Shares withheld for taxes), the Participant shall pay to the Company an amount equal to (A)&nbsp;the aggregate Fair Market Value of such Shares as of the date of exercise, plus (B)&nbsp;the excess,
	if any, of the aggregate proceeds of all sales of such Shares over the amount described under subsection (A)&nbsp;above. (For this purpose, the Participant&#146;s earliest sales of Shares following such exercise will be deemed sales of the Shares
	acquired upon such exercise.) The Company shall also be entitled to the foregoing remedies in the event of a material breach of any confidentiality,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">

	of the Plan and any provision of applicable law, stock exchange rule or Company policy relating to cancellation, recoupment, rescission or payback of compensation and expressly agrees that the Company may take such actions as are necessary to
	effectuate such policy (as applicable to the Participant) or applicable law or stock exchange rule without further consent or action being required by the Participant. For purposes of the foregoing, the Participant expressly and explicitly
	authorizes the Company to issue instructions, on the Participant&#146;s behalf, to any brokerage firm and/or third party administrator engaged by the Company to hold Participant&#146;s Shares and other amounts acquired under the Plan to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">

	Company owes the Participant from time
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage169"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	to time in an aggregate amount equal to all amounts described in subsection (ii)&nbsp;above, to the extent such deductions are permitted by applicable law. Any such deduction from an amount that
	constitutes a deferral of compensation under Code Section 409A may only take place at the time the amount would otherwise be payable to the Participant, except to the extent permitted by Code Section 409A.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	13. Successors and Assigns. The Company may assign any of its rights under this Agreement to single or multiple assignees, and this Agreement
	shall inure to the benefit of the successors and assigns of the Company. Subject to the restrictions on transfer herein set forth, the terms and conditions of the Plan and this Agreement shall be binding upon the Participant and his or her heirs,
	executors, administrators, successors and assigns.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	14. Interpretation. Any dispute regarding the interpretation of this Agreement shall
	be submitted by the Participant or by the Company forthwith to the Committee, which shall review such dispute at its next regular meeting. The resolution of such a dispute by the Committee shall be final and binding on all parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	15. Tax Consequences. The exercise of this SAR and the subsequent disposition of the Shares may cause the Participant to be subject to
	federal, state and/or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-U.S.
</FONT>
	taxation. The Participant should consult a tax advisor before exercising SARs or disposing of the Shares purchased hereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Regardless of any action the Company and/or the Employer takes with respect to any or all income tax (including U.S. federal, state and local
	taxes and/or
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-U.S.
</FONT>
	taxes), social insurance, payroll tax, payment on account or other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	tax-related
</FONT>
	withholding
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(&#147;Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items&#148;), the Participant acknowledges that the ultimate liability for all
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items legally due by the Participant is and remains the
	Participant&#146;s responsibility and that the Company and the Employer (a)&nbsp;make no representations or undertakings regarding the treatment of any Tax-Related Items in connection with any aspect of the SARs, including the grant of the SARs, the
	vesting of the SARs, the exercise of the SARs, the subsequent sale of any Shares acquired pursuant to the SARs and the receipt of any dividends and (b)&nbsp;do not commit to structure the terms of the grant or any aspect of the SARs to reduce or
	eliminate the liability for
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Prior to the delivery of Shares upon exercise of
	the SARs, if the Participant&#146;s country of residence (and/or the Participant&#146;s country of employment, if different) requires withholding of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items, unless otherwise determined by the
	Committee, the Company shall withhold a sufficient number of whole Shares otherwise issuable upon exercise of the SARs that have an aggregate Fair Market Value sufficient to pay the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items required
	to be withheld with respect to the Shares delivered upon such exercise of the SARs. The cash equivalent of the Shares withheld will be used to settle the obligation to withhold the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items. In the
	event that withholding in shares is prohibited or problematic under applicable law or otherwise may trigged adverse consequences to the Company or the Employer, the Company and/or the Employer may withhold the minimum
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items required to be withheld with respect to the Shares in cash from the Participant&#146;s regular salary and/or wages, or other amounts payable to the Participant. In the event the withholding
	requirements are not satisfied through the
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage170"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	withholding of Shares or through the Participant&#146;s regular salary and/or wages or any other amounts payable to the Participant by the Employer, no Shares will be issued to the Participant
	(or the Participant&#146;s estate) upon exercise of the SARs unless and until satisfactory arrangements (as determined by the Committee) have been made by the Participant with respect to the payment of any
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items that the Company or the Employer determines, in its sole discretion, must be withheld or collected with respect to such SARs. By accepting the SARs, the Participant expressly consents to the
	withholding of Shares and/or withholding from the Participant&#146;s regular salary and/or wages or other amounts payable to the Participant as provided for hereunder. All other
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	Tax-Related
</FONT>
	Items related to
	the SARs and any Shares delivered in payment thereof are the Participant&#146;s sole responsibility.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	16. Participant Data Privacy. As a
	condition of the grant of the SARs, the Participant consents to the collection, use and transfer of personal data as described in this paragraph. The Participant understands that the Company and its Affiliates or Subsidiaries hold certain personal
	information about the Participant, including but not limited to the Participant&#146;s name, home address, email address and telephone number, date of birth, social security number, passport or other identification number, salary, nationality, job
	title, shares of common stock or directorships held in the Company, details of all SARs or other entitlement to shares of common stock awarded, cancelled, exercised, vested, unvested or outstanding in the Participant&#146;s favor for the purpose of
	managing and administering the Plan (&#147;Data&#148;). The Participant further understands that the Company and/or its Affiliates or Subsidiaries will transfer Data amongst themselves as necessary for the purposes of implementation, administration
	and management of the Participant&#146;s participation in the Plan, and that the Company and/or any of its Affiliates or Subsidiaries may each further transfer Data to any third parties assisting the Company in the implementation, administration and
	management of the Plan. The Participant understands that these recipients may be located in the Participant&#146;s country of residence or elsewhere. The Participant authorizes them to receive, possess, use, retain and transfer Data in electronic or
	other form, for the purposes of implementing, administering and managing the Participant&#146;s participation in the Plan, including any requisite transfer of such Data as may be required for the administration of the Plan and/or the subsequent
	holding shares of common stock on the Participant&#146;s behalf to a broker or other third party with whom the shares acquired on exercise may be deposited.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Participant understands that the Participant may, at any time, view Data, request information about the storage and processing of Data,
	require any amendments to Data or refuse or withdraw the consent herein, in any case without cost, by contacting in writing the human resources representative. Further, the Participant does not consent, or if the Participant later seeks to revoke
	his or her consent, the Participant&#146;s employment status or service with his or her Employer will be unaffected; the only consequence of refusing or withdrawing the Participant&#146;s consent is that the Company would be unable to administer or
	maintain the awards. Therefore, the Participant understands that refusing or withdrawing his or her consent may affect his or her ability to receive Awards and participate in the Plan. For more information on the consequences of the
	Participant&#146;s refusal to consent or withdrawal of consent, the Participant understands that the Participant may contact his or her local human resources representative.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	17. Confidentiality. The Participant agrees not to disclose the terms of this Agreement to anyone other than the members of the
	Participant&#146;s immediately family or the Participant&#146;s counsel or financial advisors and agrees to advise such persons of the confidential nature of this offer.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage171"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	18. Section 409A; No Deferral of Compensation. Neither the Plan nor this Agreement is intended to
	provide for the deferral of compensation within the meaning of Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code (the &#147;Code&#148;). The Company reserves the right to unilaterally amend or modify this Agreement, to the extent the Company considers it
	necessary or advisable, in its sole discretion, to comply with, or to ensure that the SARs granted hereunder are not subject to, Section 409A of the Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	19. Governing Law. This Agreement and all claims arising out of or based upon this Agreement or relating to the subject matter hereof shall be
	governed by and construed in accordance with the domestic substantive laws of the State of Delaware without giving effect to any choice or conflict of laws provision or rule that would cause the application of the domestic substantive laws of any
	other jurisdiction.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any legal proceeding arising out of this Plan or this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the Federal or State
	courts located in the State of Delaware. The Participant agrees to submit to personal jurisdiction and to venue in those courts. The Participant further agrees to waive all legal challenges and defenses to the appropriateness of Delaware as the site
	of any such legal proceeding and to the application of the laws of the State of Delaware and any applicable Federal laws.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In accepting the SARs, the Participant acknowledges and agrees: (i)&nbsp;that the Plan is discretionary in nature and may be amended, cancelled, suspended or terminated by the Company at any time; (ii)&nbsp;that the
	grant of the SARs does not create any contractual or other right to receive future grants of SARs or any right to continue an employment or other relationship with the Company (for the vesting period or otherwise); (iii)&nbsp;that the Participant
	remains subject to discharge from such relationship to the same extent as if the SARs had not been granted; (iv)&nbsp;that all determinations with respect to any such future grants, including, but not limited to, when and on what terms they shall be
	made, will be at the sole discretion of the Committee; (v)&nbsp;that participation in the Plan is voluntary; (vi)&nbsp;that the value of the SARs is an extraordinary item of compensation that is outside the scope of the Participant&#146;s employment
	contract if any; and (vii)&nbsp;that the grant of SARs is not part of normal or expected compensation for purposes of calculating any severance, resignation, redundancy, end of service payments, bonuses, long-service awards, pension or retirement
	benefits or similar benefits.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	then be cancelled and no other benefit will be due to the Participant in lieu thereof. If Participant does not &#147;Decline&#148; the SARs within thirty (30)&nbsp;days from the Grant Date, the Participant shall be deemed to have accepted the SARs
	and shall be deemed to have agreed to the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement, the Plan and/or any related documents.

	statement, prospectus or other filings with the local securities authorities (unless otherwise required under local law), and the grant of the SARs is not subject to the supervision of the local securities authorities. No employee of the Company or
	any of the Company&#146;s subsidiaries is permitted to advise the Participant on whether the Participant should acquire Shares by exercising the SAR under the Plan. Investment in Shares involves a degree of risk. Before deciding to acquire Shares by
	exercising the SARs, the Participant should carefully consider all risk factors relevant to the acquisition of Shares under the Plan and the Participant should carefully review all of the materials related to the SAR and the Plan. In addition, the
	Participant should consult with the Participant&#146;s personal advisor for professional investment advice.

	subsidiaries and/or the Employer, as may be required to allow the Company and its affiliates and subsidiaries or the Employer to comply with local laws, rules and regulations in the Participant&#146;s country of residence (and country of employment,
	if different). Finally, the Participant agrees to take any and all actions as may be required to comply with the Participant&#146;s personal obligations under local laws, rules and regulations in the Participant&#146;s country of residence (and
	country of employment, if different).

</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/16/0001193125-17-046709_G321341STP043.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="16">

	James H. Erlinger, III
</TD>

	EVP, General Counsel&nbsp;&amp; Corporate Secretary
</TD>

<A NAME="eolPage176"></A>

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	PURSUANT TO QUINTILES IMS HOLDINGS, INC.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
